meta_description: Aleksei Sotskov's Product Management Portfolio web-site
pitch: Product Manager with engineering & entrepreneurship backgrounds and passion for solving real problems for the customers and businesses

About.section_data:
Builder at heart, I create products the way customers love yet that work for the business. My Product Management roots in Technology: I worked as a Product Software Engineer for 12+ years making contract work, personal and at-work side-projects as a Product Manager.

Since early 2023 I work in a Product Operating Model popularized by Marty Cagan and I love it! Currently I am looking for Co-Creators especially from Product Marketing, Product Design and Product Engineering fields. Currently I build and sell my products and services and help small offline businesses, entrepreneurs and solopreneurs to make their businesses technology-powered.

Projects.section_explanatory_text: Check out descriptions, screenshots, GIFs, videos and direct links for each of 10+ of my contract work, at-work and personal side-projects:

section_data.name: Farmer's Goods
section_data.header: an MVP of a horizontal classifier for perishable goods from locals for locals, built on a Telegram bot.
section_data.description: “Farmer's Goods” MVP was launched on April 4, 2025 to help local sellers of perishable goods (forest and garden berries, vegetables, mushrooms, fresh fish, greens, etc.) and local buyers to find each other fast and easy in a high season of Summer 2025. 3 towns are connected to test the problem and the demand.

images.description: Example of client setup survey (landing) in a bot
Example of the ad published by a seller: eggs
Example of the ad published by a seller: cheese
Example of the ad published by a seller: pepper
Analytics built to understand goods types demand in every town

section_data.name: Podarkin
section_data.header: an MVP based on a Telegram mini-app created to draw pre-New Year gifts from local brands among the citizens of a town to stimulate sales through draws.
section_data.description: “Podarkin” MVP launched on December 1, 2024 to draw presents from local brands every day till December 31, 2024 to test the idea of increasing of local brands sales through the draws. 6 brands and over 350 people participated. 250 presents have been drawn over 30 days.

images.description: Survey results table example for 1 of the brands (October 2024)
Sample of simple scratch screens designed for 1 of the brands
Draws finish (December 31, 2024). Chances to win screen
Draws finish (December 31, 2024). Settings and Brands screen
Draws finish (December 31, 2024). Check codes screen of the brand admin app
Draws finish (December 31, 2024). Gifts stats and statuses of the brand admin app
Draws in progress (December, 2024). Product analytics screen

section_data.name: Knowledge Base
section_data.header: Google Chrome side panel extension powered by Gemini Nano AI, 2024, B2C, education (side-project)
section_data.description: “Knowledge Base” app streamlines education and solves FOMO problem for the people who study a lot and have lots of opened tabs in their browsers with tons of materials to read, watch and listen. The app competed in Google Gemini AI Competition held in 2024.

section_data.name: Portfolio Template
section_data.header: template repository on GitHub with portfolio published on GitHub Pages, 2024, B2C, marketing (side-project)
section_data.description: “Portfolio Template” allows Product Managers and Engineers to better sell themselves in resumes and interviews by using personal, nice-looking, responsive portfolio web-site hosted by GitHub Pages for free.

section_data.name: Calendarium
section_data.header: automated and enriched with data from WHO and HMD version of “Life Calendar”, 2024, B2C, healthcare (side-project)
section_data.description: Added value and improved UX for already existing and selling on Amazon and Etsy “Life Calendar” product by adding data from World Health Organization (WHO) and Human Mortality Database (HMD).

section_data.name: Ubergram
section_data.header: private Telegram bot built for a travel business entrepreneur in Montenegro, 2023, B2B, travel (contract work)
section_data.description:
10x reduced chats monitoring time for an entrepreneur by building a chat-bot that processes thousands of daily messages across 5 chats and notifies an entrepreneur about prospects.
15%+ ARR increased sales for an entrepreneur by allowing them to reach prospects with compelling offers faster than competitors.
In service 24/7 since Autumn 2023.

images.description: View of a private Telegram chat with filtered transfer requests

section_data.name: DoTheyUse
section_data.description: Developed a high fidelity real-data prototype for features usage product analytics service that helps software development teams to make data-informed UX decisions and eliminate feature bloat for digital apps and services.

section_data.name: Procurements Alert
section_data.header: private Telegram bot built for a cleaning services business entrepreneur in Russia, 2022, B2B, services (contract work)
section_data.description:
Solved "lots of missed orders" problem for an entrepreneur by building a bot that parses, filters, detects and notifies about relevant procurement orders faster than competitors.
2x increased entrepreneur’s MRR within the first 6 months of bot usage.

section_data.name: SQA Mate
section_data.header: in-house service built for an advanced management of tens of thousands of manual test cases in the company, 2015-2019, B2B SaaS, SD tools (side-project at RingCentral)
section_data.description:
Identified pain points of QA Engineers and stakeholders and built and refined service MVPs with them on a daily basis.
Established DevOps procedures for fast and secure daily shipments of updates to real users.
Saved 80% of QA Engineers efforts on manual test cases management by development of test cases management system with user centred UX.

section_data.name: Pairwise
section_data.description: Empowered hundreds of QA Engineers in the world to apply pairwise testing for test cases generation faster and easily by creating a simple web UI for an existing pairwise tests library.

section_data.name: Aport
section_data.header: in-house web-app built for effective logs collection and sharing across tens of servers in tens of environments at the company, 2017, B2B SaaS, SD tools (side-project at RingCentral)
section_data.description:
Conducted weekly UX interviews with different user groups and stakeholders, yielding actionable insights that led to significant improvements of user satisfaction metrics.
By 2024 saved for RingCentral $120K+ on logs collection only.

Books.name: Join IT via Software Testing
Books.description: A book (in Russian) written to guide people who think about to transit in their careers to IT with independent from online courses marketing information — so they could know what they can and shoud expect and what are the myths.
